page.title: 13The Village Hall, Gt.Bookham
page.content:
The old{Barn Hall}in Church Rd is the principal venue for village clubs and groups, private parties and meetings. The Barn was converted in 1906 by a local land owner and presented to the village.
Since 1906, the Hall has been extended by public subscription. It is now a large complex, comprising the Barn Hall with a stage, the Harrison Room, 2 kitchens and a caretakers flat.
Leatherhead District Council were the trustees until 1948 when the building was handed over to the newly formed Bookham Community Association. In 1985 the B.C.A. is raising funds to restore the fabric of the Barn Hall.
To the W. of the Hall is a field where the Village Day Fete is held in June.
